channel.title: Open on warrick.io
channel.description: Recent content in Open on warrick.io

item.title: open
item.description: Mac OS X has an open command-line utility that I use extensively from the terminal. If ever I need to open a directory or any file with its default application, I just simply type open file and there is no need to open Finder and traverse to the directory. # open a finder window in current directory $ open . $ open http://google.com $ open image.jpg In Linux, you can get the same functionality with gnome-open:
